org.fhnw.aigs.server.gameHandling

Class StartServerAction

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.fhnw.aigs.server.gameHandling.StartServerAction
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.util.EventListener

    public class StartServerAction
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener
    Responsible for starting the server. This class will be used by the server GUI if one clicks on the button "start server", if the Console Mode is active, this action will be called automatically.
    Author:
    Matthias St√∂ckli

      Constructor and Description
      StartServerAction()
      Empty constructor, used when in console mode
      StartServerAction(javax.swing.JLabel statusLabel, javax.swing.JButton startButton, javax.swing.JButton stopButton)
      Creates an instance of StartServerAction and let the status label and the start/stop buttons reflect that the server started.

      • StartServerAction

        public StartServerAction()
        Empty constructor, used when in console mode

      • StartServerAction

        public StartServerAction(javax.swing.JLabel statusLabel,
                         javax.swing.JButton startButton,
                         javax.swing.JButton stopButton)
        Creates an instance of StartServerAction and let the status label and the start/stop buttons reflect that the server started.
        Parameters:
        statusLabel - The server status label ("online", "offline").
        startButton - The button which is used to start the server.
        stopButton - The button which is used to stop the server.

    • Method Detail

        Specified by:
        actionPerformed in interface java.awt.event.ActionListener
        Parameters:
        e - The action event.

      • startServer

        public void startServer()
        Starts the server. Starts the communication and the KeepAliveManager.
